article.title: A Feasibility Study of Centralized and Regionalized Inter-LibraryLoan Centers
article.author: Stevens, R.E.
article.text: The two major problems of the present system are (1) the unequal distribution of lending, with a few of the largest libraries handling a large proportion of the requests, and (2) the difficulty of filling requests which are incomplete, incorrect, or inadequately checked. Solutions proposed for these two problems have been (1) compensation to the largest libraries for each transaction, and (2) better bibliographic checking of requests before they are forwarded to the lending library.
